author: Mike Peters
date_of_review: Reviewed in the United States on March 18, 2020
review_content: This is a great value at less than $10.  I have seen some negative comments on the reviews, but I simply cannot imagine how anyone can be unhappy with a useful, functional product like this; one that is so darn affordable.  There are a couple things I would improve and I will list them at the end of this review, but those small issues will not stop me from giving this a 5 STAR review.  Some reviewers mention it is easy to clean the inside and I am certain that it is, but I wanted a liner.  I could not find anything online, so I used a plastic grocery bag, held up by an inner support brace that I made from the box the shipment came in.  I cut a half inch strip of cardboard and bent it to form the corners of the mouth of this container.  I used a couple of staples to join the two ends, then inserted the plastic bag into the container.  The top of the bag was wrapped over this rube goldberg support brace, and the brace is held in place by a couple of small binder clips, which also help to make the sides of the unit a little more sturdy.  PROBLEMS? . They are minor - there are instructions, but they are vague, would like to see more words to accompany the drawings.  Two side strips are provided, and these are intended to give some rigidity to the edges of the bag.  After looking long and hard for some pouches to slip these into, I realized the intention was simply to have these tucked behind the side straps; the plastic inserts are long enough that you sort of have to wedge them in there, so I imagine the manufacturer is expecting that to hold the black plastic support inserts in place.  We'll see how that lasts over time, but it would be nice to have loops or a pouch to actually hold them in place.  Not a huge deal though - this is a great buy and I am going to order a 2nd one for my other car.
title: GREAT PRODUCT  |  GREAT VALUE
